shortcv.p: Dimitris Drossos holds a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science from the University of Crete and an MSc with Distinction in E-commerce from the Athens University of Economics and Business (AUEB). Currently, he is a PhD student in the Department of Management Science and Technology at AUEB. Mobile marketing and advertising effectiveness are his central points of research and other interests focus on m-commerce technologies and services. He is also Research Officer in ELTRUN/WRC, where he is involved in several European and National research projects. In the past he worked in several companies with diverse research domains including Hellenic National Meteorological Service, University of Crete net (UCnet), IP Datacom & Services Ericsson Stockholm, Atlantis Group Univ. of Crete, and Foundation for Research and Technology - Hellas (ICS-FORTH).

phd-info.phd-summary: Technological advances bring forth new and innovative advertising media, such as the Internet, interactive television, and, more recently, mobile messaging advertising. According to the Interactive Mobile Advertising Platform mobile advertising is defined as “the business of encouraging people to buy products and services using the wireless channel as medium to deliver the advertisement message”. Mobile advertising (m-advertising) enables not only sending unique, personalised, and customised ads, but also engaging consumers in dialogues and transactions with the brand. In view of the perennial effort to examine determinants of successful advertising campaigns through the bundle of advertising media, this PhD also attempts to conceptualize factors that influence the effects of a mobile messaging advertising campaign, referring especially to push advertising via Short Messaging Service (SMS) text.
